review_title: POTENTIALLY a great place to work
pros: As a university, they really care about their students. They intentionally hire qualified employees who will not only provide strong academics but will truly be there for students, especially spiritually. There are lots of great people, and I think most genuinely mean well. There are several fun events throughout the year to unify the different departments. They communicate well across the board. As a part-time employee, I didn't have benefits, but I've heard their benefits are excellent. And I know many employees feel that it is one of the best places you could work - it is consistently named one of the best Christian workplaces.
cons: As a former student, I became very disillusioned with the university during the time I worked there. Certain departments and employees are heavily favored and seemingly can do no wrong. Other departments and employees/position aren't well-respected or recognized. And as a heads up, their zero-tolerance for alcohol extends to employees as well.

review_title: Best Christian Workplace not entirely accurate
job_title: Public Safety Officer in Bourbonnais, IL
pros: Great atmosphere, Friendly student body, staff, and faculty, available OT, not ran like a corporation. They do plan ahead far in advanced for certain financial aspects. Makes you feel included and like you're family because of the small amount of employees. President was very down to earth and a humble person.
cons: Supervisors not really involved with employees, pay wasn't competitive and I feel they hope other aspects of the job make up for it. Being non-profit they always talk about how tight money is yet spend a lot of money on constant renovations .

review_title: Corrupt at its Core "We don't believe you belong here"
job_title: Public Safety Officer in Bourbonnais, IL
pros: Steady work schedule, decent benefits, education assistance for employees is good.  If you like the color purple and enjoy slave labor, this is the place for you.
cons: Very corrupt business, operates outside the law and ethics, uses their money and power to control the outcome in their favor.  Does not appreciate lower level employees, uses fear as bullying as management tactics. Low pay, no raises, says they can't afford it, however they bought sponsorship of the Cubs, Bears, and Colts.  That money came from firing good people for no reason.  Does not take employee safety seriously.  Don't drink the kool-aid.

job_title: Senior Marketing Associate / Marketing Manager in Bourbonnais, IL
pros: Awesome work environment, great interaction with people. Very relational along with some behind the scenes recruitment. The people you work with are great and very supportive. Honestly some of the most kind people you will ever work for and very good at invsting in you as a person.
cons: Have to be willing to do the behind the scenes work that most people don't want to do. Sometimes management can be a little passive aggressive and not as assertive as somebody with my personality would like them to be.

job_title: Senior Marketing Associate / Marketing Manager in Bourbonnais, IL
pros: It was a great place to work and the people I worked for were awesome. They encouraged me to try strive for higher goals and pushed me to do better
cons: Some of my coworkers were a bit lazy sometimes and tried to see how little they could get away with.

review_title: A caring and friendly environment, but little room for advancement without connections.
pros: The people you will work with at Olivet are some of the best around.  The university truly does try to commit itself to excellence in all that they do.  Most employees will go the extra mile to be helpful and kind.  It is family friendly- flexible scheduling and the appreciate their employees.
cons: Without the correct connections, career advancement is difficult.

pros: Lots of great responsibilities and absolutely phenomenal employers who legitimately care.  You are constantly reminded that you and your position are important to the well-being of the university.
cons: The pay for being a resident assistant was absolutely abysmal and was not at all appropriate for the amount of work that was put in, nor was it appropriate considering how much other student workers who do significantly less make.

pros: It's a pretty stable place. If you're looking for a strong Christian environment this could be a good fit. Great leadership from John Bowling. Incredible health insurance and time off including paternal leave.
cons: Nepotism by the bucketload. Slow to change. Slower to innovate.
